CatDescriptText: C.L. Jefferson, airlines employee, Homewood, and Leonard Stevenson, laborer, West End were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 30, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Are you in favor of increasing the city wage tax to pay salaries for additional police officers in Pittsburgh?  Say, about 500 more?"  Mr. Jefferson's answer reads: "An increase in the wage tax would be justified to provide additional policemen...For example, in Homewood, we are experiencing a more secure feeling, because beat policemen have been restored...I am 100 per cent for an increase."  Mr. Stevenson's answer reads: "Yes.  We need more policemen because of the growing population."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of C.L. Jefferson wearing dark cap and zippered jacket, standing in front of block building, Downtown; Portrait of Leonard Stevenson wearing dark hat with light colored woven band and light colored overcoat, standing in front of block wall, Downtown
